ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: NMR and X-ray crystallography for the inorganic chemist. Yes , I would since it's useful for research.
It's a class which is a good mix of theoretical and practical knowledge. You definitely learn more than in the other classes so I definitely recommend it.
Yes, it is very helpful for the inorganic chemists.

CHEM 550 is an overview of techniques commonly used in the inorganic lab, with an emphasis on practical aspects (spectra interpretation and sample preparation, for example) over theoretical underpinnings.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Helped me understand how to apply physical methods in inorganic chemistry to my own research.
It's a great survey course of various techniques that are useful for inorganic chemists.

This course was a useful review of, and extension on, material covered in my previous spectroscopy and inorganic coursework. I use many of the techniques covered in this class on a day-to-day basis; in that sense, the course content is intimately tied to my research.
